sections.purpose: To store large quantities of prepared media and bulk reagents at 2°C to 8°C.
sections.scope: Applicable to storage management in Microbiology.
procedure: Ensure the cabinet is powered and maintaining the correct temperature.
Organize materials into sections (e.g., Prepared Media, Reagents, Standards).
Ensure all items are clearly labeled with names and dates.
Monitor the internal temperature daily using a calibrated thermometer.
Clean the interior shelves with a disinfectant once a month.
Review the inventory regularly and dispose of expired materials.
Ensure the door is kept closed and the magnetic seal is functional.
Record the daily temperature readings in the cabinet log.
precautions: Do not store food, beverages, or volatile chemicals in the cabinet.
Minimize the duration of door openings.
Ensure proper airflow around stored items.
Follow a 'First-In, First-Out' (FIFO) system for all stored media.
Regularly check for signs of moisture or frost buildup.
